About Us

A not-for-profit initiative focused on bridging the worlds of audio-visuals and creative coding.

CtrlReturn

â€“ where music meets coding! During this 2-day event at c-base, we'll dive into real-time music creation using code and exploring different platforms for audiovisual performance.

The Event

Our event provides a platform to explore the creative synergies between music and coding. Over the course of two days, attendees will engage in four workshops, which will cover topics such as real-time music creation using Python and the integration of music live coding with other Python modules and data sources. Participants will learn to leverage computational methods for sonification and music making, transforming data patterns and events into immersive auditory experiences.

Post-dinner, two music live coding performances offer a relaxed environment for networking and enjoyment, especially for PyCon.DE & PyData Berlin attendees, as our event is just 15 minutes away. We are collaborating with the organizers to engage participants, making it an ideal opportunity to unwind and connect.

LIVE CODE AND LET CODE LIVE

Our motivation stems from the belief that strengthening Python's role in creative self-expression enhances its appeal. By integrating Python into music creation, we tap into the universal language of music, connecting with people on a profound level.

This initiative aims to stimulate engagement with Python and programming, particularly among young people. Recognizing the significant role music plays in shaping identities, we believe this event will bring individuals into contact with Python and its vibrant community, fostering a sense of belonging and collaboration.
